Submodules

cmipaccess.data_access module

cmipaccess.data_access.get_CMIP6_data(model, experiment, realisation, variable, grid=None, freq='mon', source='spiritx', esgf_fallback=True, **xr_kwargs)[source]

Loads gridded CMIP6 data from spirit or esgf

Parameters:

  • model (str) – Climate model name

  • experiment (str) – Experiment name

  • realisation (str) – member id

  • variable (str) – variable name

  • grid (str, optional) – grid id. Defaults to None.

  • freq (str, optional) – temporal frequency of the data required. Defaults to ‘mon’.

  • source (str, optional) – source of the data. Can either be esgf or spiritx. Defaults to ‘spiritx’.

  • esgf_fallback (bool, optional) – If the source is spiritx, tries finding the data on ESGF if not available on SpiritX. Defaults to True.

Return type:

xarray.Dataset containing the experiment data for the given variable.

cmipaccess.path_search module

cmipaccess.path_search.get_path_CMIP_data(model, experiment, realisation, variable, grid=None, freq='mon', source='spiritx', esgf_fallback=True, generation=None)[source]

Returns path to access gridded CMIP data from either CMIP5 or CMIP6

grid : default is ‘gn’ native grid, only for CMIP6 freq : can be ‘mon’, ‘day’, ‘3h’ or else, see CMIP documentation source : can be ‘spiritx’ for local access or ‘esgf’ for remote access esgf_fallback : if source is ‘spiritx’ but the dataset is not found, tries to get remote data from esgf generation : specify the generation wanted : either ‘CMIP5’ or ‘CMIP6’. If None, it tries CMIP6 first then CMIP5 which can be slower.

cmipaccess.path_search.print_list(model_list)[source]
